body:
This commit enhances root directory detection of mesonlsp language server.
Current behavior:
`root` is set on first meson file user is opened
New behavior:
`root` is set to parent of `meson.build` with `project` function call

comment_data.body: not accepting changes to old configs
docstring should give an example of the line this is trying to find. shouldn't have to study the code to figure that out.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3,8 +3,33 @@
 --- https://github.com/JCWasmx86/mesonlsp
 ---
 --- An unofficial, unendorsed language server for meson written in C++
+
+local meson_matcher = function(_, path)

comment_data.body: I don't understand what you mean, can you explain in more detail please?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3,8 +3,33 @@
 --- https://github.com/JCWasmx86/mesonlsp
 ---
 --- An unofficial, unendorsed language server for meson written in C++
+
+local meson_matcher = function(_, path)

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
--- Decides if a file is a meson file by looking for lines like:
--- "foo.bar" or "baz"
local meson_matcher = function(_, path)
```

replace "foo.bar" with an actual example
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3,8 +3,33 @@
 --- https://github.com/JCWasmx86/mesonlsp
 ---
 --- An unofficial, unendorsed language server for meson written in C++
+
+local meson_matcher = function(_, path)

comment_data.body: what is an example of text content that this looks for ?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3,8 +3,33 @@
 --- https://github.com/JCWasmx86/mesonlsp
 ---
 --- An unofficial, unendorsed language server for meson written in C++
+
+local meson_matcher = function(_, path)

@@ -3,8 +3,33 @@
 --- https://github.com/JCWasmx86/mesonlsp
 ---
 --- An unofficial, unendorsed language server for meson written in C++
+
+local meson_matcher = function(_, path)

comment_data.body:
`vim.filetype.match()` exists for this purpose. However,

    vim.filetype.match({ filename = f, contents = 'project' })

seems to return "meson" even if the file doesn't contain "project", which isn't what you want here.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3,8 +3,35 @@
 --- https://github.com/JCWasmx86/mesonlsp
 ---
 --- An unofficial, unendorsed language server for meson written in C++
+
+---Checks if a given path contains a valid Meson project root file
+---Looks for 'meson.build' file which contains 'project()' function
+local meson_matcher = function(_, path)
+  local pattern = 'meson.build'
+  local f = vim.fn.glob(table.concat({ path, pattern }, '/'))
+  if f == '' then
+    return false
+  end
+  for line in io.lines(f) do
+    -- skip meson comments
+    if not line:match '^%s*#.*' then
+      local str = line:gsub('%s+', '')
+      if str ~= '' then
+        if str:match '^project%(' then
+          return true
+        else
+          break

comment_data.body: For mesonlsp root_dir is required to be at folder with 'project' file. If root will be in different place all file will be underlined with red. I just take code from vala_ls which finds project root perfectly.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3,8 +3,35 @@
 --- https://github.com/JCWasmx86/mesonlsp
 ---
 --- An unofficial, unendorsed language server for meson written in C++
+
+---Checks if a given path contains a valid Meson project root file
+---Looks for 'meson.build' file which contains 'project()' function
+local meson_matcher = function(_, path)
+  local pattern = 'meson.build'
+  local f = vim.fn.glob(table.concat({ path, pattern }, '/'))
+  if f == '' then
+    return false
+  end
+  for line in io.lines(f) do

+      local str = line:gsub('%s+', '')
+      if str ~= '' then
+        if str:match '^project%(' then
+          return true
+        else

comment_data.body:
>  I just take code from vala_ls which finds project root perfectly.

Yeah, I'm trying to find more concise patterns so that we don't have to maintain 10x as much code in all of these configs.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3,8 +3,35 @@
 --- https://github.com/JCWasmx86/mesonlsp
 ---
 --- An unofficial, unendorsed language server for meson written in C++
+
+---Checks if a given path contains a valid Meson project root file
+---Looks for 'meson.build' file which contains 'project()' function
+local meson_matcher = function(_, path)
+  local pattern = 'meson.build'
+  local f = vim.fn.glob(table.concat({ path, pattern }, '/'))
+  if f == '' then
+    return false
+  end
+  for line in io.lines(f) do
+    -- skip meson comments
+    if not line:match '^%s*#.*' then
+      local str = line:gsub('%s+', '')
+      if str ~= '' then
+        if str:match '^project%(' then
+          return true
+        else
+          break

title: fix(mesonlsp): improved root detection
